jgm-ktg commented on issue #4467: ARROW-5439: [Java] [WIP] Write EOS identifier for sequential readers
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4467#issuecomment-499332560
 
 
   > @jgm-ktg normally we like to see unit tests at the same time that we merge code, when do you think you will be able to add one? Maybe label the PR as WIP or close it until you can add one?
   
   @emkornfield I have to grab a few minutes here and there for contributions since I have to focus mostly on my other work.  For this reason I thought I would stage a PR even though I know it isn't done... this way if I never come back, or it takes some time, any onlooker has the opportunity to run with it if they so choose.
   
   If you and other major contributors think it is better not to have the pending work public in a PR until I know I can finish it, I will adjust.  I marked it WIP for now.  I suppose another option is that I could put the proposed code in JIRA until I'm "really done" ?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org

tianchen92 commented on pull request #4966: ARROW-5439: [Java] Utilize stream EOS in File format
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4966
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-5439](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5439).
   We currently do not write EOS at the end of a Message stream inside the File format.  As a result, the file cannot be parsed sequentially.  This change prepares for other implementations or future reference features that parse a File sequentially... i.e. without access to seek().
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: We currently do not write EOS at the end of a Message stream inside the File format.  As a result, the file cannot be parsed sequentially.  This change prepares for other implementations or future reference features that parse a File sequentially... i.e. without access to seek().
fields.summary: [Java] Utilize stream EOS in File format

comments.body: cc [~emkornfield@gmail.com] Since this ticket is pending for a long time, I would like to provide a PR:).
